summary: Is it Vegan, Vegetarian, Gluten-Free? Check if food has ingredients you avoid.
recentChanges:
We opened up Chomp to everyone by allowing you to customize the ingredients we check. Add ingredients you want to avoid and we'll let you know when a food contains it.

This is especially helpful if you're not vegan, vegetarian, or avoid gluten. Now you can use Chomp to avoid ingredients that you have sensitivities toward or to just avoid an ingredient or two.
comments: I just found out about this app & immediately downloaded. It's user friendly format is designed for complete user customization & not the usual, limited "cookie-cutter" app. I'm vegan & am thrilled to have this app at my fingertips when shopping & checking EVERY ingredient on every label. All I have to do is scan the barcode & I receive my preferenced dietary report and/or alert of non-vegan ingredients. This useful tool is ESPECIALLY handy for those w/ food sensitivies and allergens.
great app but not enough ingredient info

Great idea, although I think YOU need to read the ingredients a little closer. You say Beyond Chicken isn't vegan because it has chicken in it...but if you read the ingredients, you can clearly see that it's vegan. Yeah, you have over 850,000 foods, but how many of your claims about those foods are accurate?

title: Fooducate - Eat better. Lose weight. Get healthy.
description:
Lose weight and keep it off. Eat tasty, healthy, real food. Track your calories, macros, and workouts. Get motivation from the most supportive community in the world. 

Fooducate is the only app that analyzes and recommends foods based on their ingredient quality. No more tricks by sneaky food manufacturers!

THE BEST NUTRITION & HEALTH TRACKER
+ A meal tracker and so much more
+ Track your food intake and exercise 
+ Track the quality of calories
+ Track your macros: protein, fats, carbs

HUGE FOOD DATABASE
+ Scan over 250,000 product barcodes 
+ Get a personalized nutrition grade (A, B, C, or D) for each food
+ Get suggestions for healthier foods based on what you scan

THE BEST DIET TIPS
+ Free health & diet tips from nutrition professionals
+ Free weight loss tips
+ Motivation, love & support from the community

FOODUCATE TEACHES YOU TO EAT FOR HEALTH!
Fooducate analyzes information found in product nutrition panels and ingredient lists. Scan to discover things manufacturers don't want you to notice:
- added sugars
- artificial sweeteners such as aspartame
- trans fats 
- high fructose corn syrup 
- MSG
- controversial food colorings 
- GMO - genetical modified organisms (premium feature) 
- additives and preservatives 
- and more... 

THE BEST WEIGHT LOSS APP
‚Ä¢ 1st prize - US Surgeon General's Healthy App Challenge 
‚Ä¢ Featured multiple times on the Google Play store
‚Ä¢ Media praise: USAToday, NYTimes, Dr. Oz, Oprah, WSJ, ABC, FOX,. . . 
‚Ä¢ Recommended by doctors, dietitians, fitness trainers, and your friends 

PERSONALIZE FOODUCATE
- age, gender,weight, height, activity level
- desired weight loss rate
- carb control
- health conditions (low cholesterol, pregnancy,...)
- dietary goals (non processed foods, vegetarian)
- avoid MSG, HFCS, GMOs and other ingredients
- Gluten free and other allergens
(Note: some personalization features require a premium account)

IN-APP PURCHASES
Get the most out of Fooducate with these premium features:

* Pro
‚Äî> Low-carb diet

---> Paleo
----> Mediterranean diet

‚Äî> No ads.

‚Äî> Includes gluten, milk, lactose, soy, peanuts, tree nuts, eggs, fish, and shellfish
‚Äî> Priority support. 

* Diet Kickstart

* Pet Food 
‚Äî> choose the healthiest food for your dog and cat

recentChanges:
* You can now log your food servings in either servings (i.e. 1 cup) or measurements (i.e. 230 milliliters).
* A few bug fixes.
comments: This is such a great idea, and I can see the developers are really putting their hearts and souls into this. Unfortunately, the mobile app component doesn't quite work the way I would like it to, and maybe that's just me. 1) I spent an hour exploring the features and how to do everything, and there were just way too many rabbit holes I fell into - oops, that didn't do quite what I thought it would - backtrack, start over. I would like to see more simplicity. 2) I'm disappointed you have to get the app to get the Health Tracker feature. I can see the benefit of being able to gather information on the fly without having to visit your desktop computer, but when there's a lot of typing involved (for searches and such) it would be nice to be able to manage that date from my desktop computer. 3) When I first signed up for this, I envisioned a tracking feature that, once I entered everything I ate on a given day, would give me a summary of all the nutrients included in all I ate that day. I only found calories, fats, carbs, and [some other thing I can't remember now]. You can make that a pro feature, but I did not see where you have done this. 4) I would have strongly considered the Pro version if it included a "low fat" profile.

On Android, when you click Contact Us, it gives me options to share content via other apps?? No info on how to contact the Devs about issues. Also, if I scan a barcode that's not in the system, it asks me to take 3 pictures. After I do, I get the same issue as the Contact Us button, with a pop up to share content. So I can only add food by searching for it and clicking add food at the bottom of the screen. Otherwise the app is good. The UI could be cleaned up a bit, but I'm happy with it so far.

I thought this app was a really great idea and I still think it is but it doesn't seem like anybody is really putting any work into it there's a lot of good foods out there that they're saying is bad for no good reason they're foods out there that are slightly processed or have a little bit of added sugar that are way better than a lot of other things but they're going to make you think that it's not good because it's slightly processed. processed doesn't mean bad

It wouldn't keep my manual changes to calories and target date, etc. When I went to "contact us," it kept taking me to a quick share option that didn't provide me with any email or other form of contact information. Very frustrating

Such a great app not only for tracking my food, but also for finding better options when it comes to some foods. I love that you can scan the barcode on a package (most packages) and get a letter grade and explanation for it's grade (whether it's preservatives, added sugar, etc). And as mentioned, it will offer alternatives to the scanned item so that you might be able to find a similar but healthier option. I do pay for premium now but even before that I found the app immensely helpful shopping

Gluten Free Recipes app contains a huge selection of more than 60 different gluten free recipes ready for you to make.

We also have more than 200 recipes ready, and we will be adding even more with each upcoming update. 

Make sure to check this app if you like food that doesn't contain gluten. 

If you have any questions, feel free to contact us anytime.

title: Sift Food Labels
description:
Sift Food Labels breaks down complicated ingredient labels so you know what‚Äôs in your food. Simply scan the barcode of any food product and Sift will translate the ingredients into easy-to-understand terms - flagging ingredients that are banned in other countries. All for FREE!

Sift also offers additional support for lifestyle diets. Currently supporting - Dairy Free, FODMAP, Gluten Free, No Added Sugar, Paleo, Soy Free, Vegan, Whole30.

We have made it our mission to provide you with transparent information around food ingredients. Why?
- Food labels are complicated and often designed to trick you. 
- Over 3,000 additives are approved for use in our foods.
- There are more than 60 different words used for sugar on our food labels.
- 80% of the foods in your pantry are likely to contain ingredients banned in other countries due to the serious health risks they pose.

DIET SUBSCRIPTION PLANS:

‚Ä¢ All plans are selected and purchased on a per-diet basis. 

‚Ä¢ Monthly Subscription ($2.99/Month): 1 month of unlimited product scans for your selected diet via Sift's ingredient insights on your Android device for $2.99. Payment for this plan will be charged to your Google Play Account at confirmation of purchase. The subscription will automatically renew unless auto-renew is turned off at least 24-hours before the end of the current period.

‚Ä¢ Yearly Subscription ($19.99/Year): 1 year of unlimited product scans for your selected diet via Sift's ingredient insights on your Android device for $19.99. Payment for this plan will be charged to your Google Play Account at confirmation of purchase. The subscription will automatically renew unless auto-renew is turned off at least 24-hours before the end of the current period.

‚Ä¢ Buy All Subscription ($39.99/Year): 1 year of unlimited product scans for all diets via Sift's ingredient insights on your Android device for $39.99. Payment for this plan will be charged to your Google Play Account at confirmation of purchase. The subscription will automatically renew unless auto-renew is turned off at least 24-hours before the end of the current period.

By completing your purchase, you certify that you understand and agree to the Terms of Service (https://api.siftfoodlabels.com/tos) and Privacy Policy (https://www.iubenda.com/privacy-policy/7963816/legal). Auto-renewal may be turned off in your Account Setting in Google Play after purchase. A user that cancels during a subscription month will not be charged for the following month.

I loaded this app 2 times frist time i set it up with password an all sent me email conformation i was good. Go to log in an it wont take my password i tried more then once so i clicked forgot password and it said it sent me a email. No email did this more then once. If this is how the app works no thanks. I know my password was right as i write them down before i enter them. Will not let me set up a new account said it already exist. An wont send me a passcode to change the password

This app is amazing! my daughter and I enjoy using the app and she is only 4 years old! I'm trying my best to start early with grooming her and her brother to eat more healthily, and we are amazed at some of the foods we eat on a daily basis that are not good for us. She and I love it!

title: Food Intolerances
description:
The app Food Intolerances is a tool to help everyone who has to stick to a restricted diet because of food intolerances or allergies. Typical application cases are: histamine intolerance, mastocytosis, fructose malabsorption, sorbitol intolerance, aspirin intolerance, gluten sensitivity, lactose intolerance or a diet low in FODMAPs.

Latest awards*:
Healthline ‚Äì Best Nutrition Apps 2019
MeinAllergiePortal ‚Äì Digital Health Heroes Award 2018

‚Ä¢ We added a new profile for nickel allergy.

comments: It's a good start for me and worth the purchase. Surprising number of foods are missing. Looking forward to regular updates. The extra clinical info in the notes on many foods are very helpful.

I really liked this app until I had a salicylate reaction after I bought cranberry juice because they have it listed as green for salicylates, but it's actually Very High Salicylate. The wikipedia link they provided had no mention of the salicylate content of cranberries. It wasn't until I searched it further on reliable allergy sites that I came across it repeatedly marked as VHS. Very disappointed.

The app you've always needed!!! Let's you add multiple intolerances and visually colors them to help you see what you can and can't eat. Easy to update tolerances for multiple people. So simple love it!

Would be nice to filter only green/yellow+green categories and maybe save that filter. It would help to find out which type of foods aren't working for me and causing me issues. I think it's histamines but not sure yet.

I'm glad I decided to spend a little bit of money to buy this app. The food database is very big, the filter options work great and the info is solid. The only places where I saw inconsistencies with other sources are actually current subjects of debate in the scientific community so it seems like the creators did a very good job compiling the info. The only slight beef I have with the app is that it's not very appealing to the eye but the simplicity of the UI is great!

Gluten Free Recipes app contains a huge selection of more than 60 different gluten free recipes ready for you to make.

We also have more than 200 recipes ready, and we will be adding even more with each upcoming update. 

Make sure to check this app if you like food that doesn't contain gluten. 

If you have any questions, feel free to contact us anytime.

title: Sift Food Labels
description:
Sift Food Labels breaks down complicated ingredient labels so you know what‚Äôs in your food. Simply scan the barcode of any food product and Sift will translate the ingredients into easy-to-understand terms - flagging ingredients that are banned in other countries. All for FREE!

Sift also offers additional support for lifestyle diets. Currently supporting - Dairy Free, FODMAP, Gluten Free, No Added Sugar, Paleo, Soy Free, Vegan, Whole30.

We have made it our mission to provide you with transparent information around food ingredients. Why?
- Food labels are complicated and often designed to trick you. 
- Over 3,000 additives are approved for use in our foods.
- There are more than 60 different words used for sugar on our food labels.
- 80% of the foods in your pantry are likely to contain ingredients banned in other countries due to the serious health risks they pose.

DIET SUBSCRIPTION PLANS:

‚Ä¢ All plans are selected and purchased on a per-diet basis. 

‚Ä¢ Monthly Subscription ($2.99/Month): 1 month of unlimited product scans for your selected diet via Sift's ingredient insights on your Android device for $2.99. Payment for this plan will be charged to your Google Play Account at confirmation of purchase. The subscription will automatically renew unless auto-renew is turned off at least 24-hours before the end of the current period.

‚Ä¢ Yearly Subscription ($19.99/Year): 1 year of unlimited product scans for your selected diet via Sift's ingredient insights on your Android device for $19.99. Payment for this plan will be charged to your Google Play Account at confirmation of purchase. The subscription will automatically renew unless auto-renew is turned off at least 24-hours before the end of the current period.

‚Ä¢ Buy All Subscription ($39.99/Year): 1 year of unlimited product scans for all diets via Sift's ingredient insights on your Android device for $39.99. Payment for this plan will be charged to your Google Play Account at confirmation of purchase. The subscription will automatically renew unless auto-renew is turned off at least 24-hours before the end of the current period.

By completing your purchase, you certify that you understand and agree to the Terms of Service (https://api.siftfoodlabels.com/tos) and Privacy Policy (https://www.iubenda.com/privacy-policy/7963816/legal). Auto-renewal may be turned off in your Account Setting in Google Play after purchase. A user that cancels during a subscription month will not be charged for the following month.

I have food reactions and in order to track down and compare ingredients this app is great.
I'm having the same problem as most people who are writing reviews...It will not allow me to sign up.

I loaded this app 2 times frist time i set it up with password an all sent me email conformation i was good. Go to log in an it wont take my password i tried more then once so i clicked forgot password and it said it sent me a email. No email did this more then once. If this is how the app works no thanks. I know my password was right as i write them down before i enter them. Will not let me set up a new account said it already exist. An wont send me a passcode to change the password

This app is amazing! my daughter and I enjoy using the app and she is only 4 years old! I'm trying my best to start early with grooming her and her brother to eat more healthily, and we are amazed at some of the foods we eat on a daily basis that are not good for us. She and I love it!

title: Gluten-free Cookery, The Complete Guide
description:
A Gluten free recipe book with hundreds of recipes and ideas for living gluten-free. You can attach your own notes to each recipe.
This guide provides clear descriptions and suggestions for use of the wide range of tasty foods that can be enjoyed as part of a gluten free or wheat free diet.
It includes instructions for preparing and cooking a wide range of gluten free and wheat free meals and snacks, from bread and pancakes to Christmas pudding and party meals.
The gluten and wheat free diet using a wide range of ingredients is a very healthy diet. There is no need to cook separate meals for those who require this diet, simply provide it for everyone in the family. This philosophy works equally well for children's parties or for adult dinner parties. If you select the menu from the recipes in this book they won't know that food you serve is gluten and wheat free.
If you are preparing food for gluten free guests do reassure them that the recipes come from this book and they can eat freely of all that you serve.
A gluten free or wheat free diet is essential for health for many people. It is not a diet that can be given up or forgotten about for a short time.
I have to eat a gluten free diet as I suffer from the coeliac condition. I have enjoyed preparing this book and I hope that you enjoy following these recipes and eating these meals.
Peter Thomson
This book was originally published by Hodder and Stoughton.
Now updated and published by the Author.

title: Healthy Celiac Disease - Gluten Free Diet Recipe
description:
Gluten in food is the major cause of celiac disease. There are a variety of foods you can eat which are gluten free. This application contains the best gluten free recipes by top chefs for celiac diet.

People with celiac disease are the original adopters of a gluten-free diet. Celiac disease is a condition characterized by gluten intolerance, which, when gluten is consumed damages the intestinal lining resulting in bloating, chronic diarrhea, constipation, stomach aches, nausea, and vomiting, among others. There is no cure, so the only way for people with celiac disease to avoid these symptoms is to avoid these foods altogether.

When you are diagnosed with Celiac disease or gluten intolerance, your life can become quite difficult if you don't know how or where to find food that is gluten free. The good news is that you can, it just takes a little effort on your part to learn how you can find the foods that you love, gluten free. So..Don't Worry Now, because if You Install the Application that mean you will have the best Celiac Food List Recipes can use to cooking everyday.

If you want to go completely gluten free then Gluten Free or Celiac Cookbook is the best application for you. descriptionHTML:
Gluten in food is the major cause of celiac disease. There are a variety of foods you can eat which are gluten free. This application contains the best gluten free recipes by top chefs for celiac diet.

People with celiac disease are the original adopters of a gluten-free diet. Celiac disease is a condition characterized by gluten intolerance, which, when gluten is consumed damages the intestinal lining resulting in bloating, chronic diarrhea, constipation, stomach aches, nausea, and vomiting, among others. There is no cure, so the only way for people with celiac disease to avoid these symptoms is to avoid these foods altogether.

When you are diagnosed with Celiac disease or gluten intolerance, your life can become quite difficult if you don't know how or where to find food that is gluten free. title: Gluten-free Cookery
description:
A special launch price for you to try this cookery book on your mobile. I hope you will try a recipe and give a rating on this site and give some feedback. The cakes are particularly good!
 A Gluten free recipe book with hundreds of recipes and ideas for living gluten-free. You can attach your own notes to each recipe. 
This guide provides clear descriptions and suggestions for use of the wide range of tasty foods that can be enjoyed as part of a gluten free or wheat free diet.
  It includes instructions for preparing and cooking a wide range of gluten free and wheat free meals and snacks, from bread and pancakes to Christmas pudding and party meals.
  The gluten and wheat free diet using a wide range of ingredients is a very healthy diet. There is no need to cook separate meals for those who require this diet, simply provide it for everyone in the family. This philosophy works equally well for children's parties or for adult dinner parties. If you select the menu from the recipes in this book they won't know that food you serve is gluten and wheat free.
  If you are preparing food for gluten free guests do reassure them that the recipes come from this book and they can eat freely of all that you serve.
  A gluten free or wheat free diet is essential for health for many people. It is not a diet that can be given up or forgotten about for a short time.
  I have to eat a gluten free diet as I suffer from the coeliac condition. I have enjoyed preparing this book and I hope that you enjoy following these recipes and eating these meals.
  Peter Thomson
This book was originally published by Hodder and Stoughton.
Now updated and published by the Author.

title: Open Food Facts - Scan food. Get the Nutriscore
description:
‚ñ∂ Scan, find & compare more than 1,3 million food products

The app allows to scan the 1,3 million products already contained in the free and open database Open Food Facts.
The app is collaborative. If we don't have the product, you can add pictures and data to get the Nutri-Score and NOVA score on food processing.

In short, we're kind of "the Wikipedia of food", as many have nicknamed the project. Open Food Facts has enabled the creation of over 100 apps like Date Limite, Yuka or FoodVisor.

To discover the volunteer-run Open Food Facts project, visit https://world.openfoodfacts.org/discover

‚ñ∂ Choose the products that are good for you

‚ûú The Nutri-Score grade, from A to E :  Nutritional quality
‚ûú The NOVA group, from 1 to 4 : Avoid ultra-processed foods (Group 4)

‚ñ∂ Contribute to Food Transparency

‚ûú Open Food Facts is a food products database made by everyone, for everyone.
‚ûú You can use it to make better food choices, and as it is open data, anyone can re-use it for any purpose.
‚ûú You can start contributing today by adding a product from your fridge.
‚ûú Open Food Facts is a non-profit project developed by thousands of volunteers from around the world. We have lots of exciting projects you can contribute to in many different ways.

‚ñ∂ Decipher food labels

‚ûú Open Food Facts helps you decipher products labels. You will be able to find:
‚ûú carbon footprint (CO2 emissions) and packaging (as well as recycling instructions),
‚ûú Nutriscore (nutritional score), nutrients, fat / fat content, saturated fatty acids, carbohydrates, sugars, fiber, protein and salt and sodium.
‚ûú brands, allergens, labels (bio, gluten free, vegan, vegetarian, halal, kosher ...), traceability information (packaging codes, origins of ingredients)
‚ûú On wines and beers, you will find the alcohol content.

‚ñ∂ Our grades are science-based, and the project is helping science back!
‚ûú We don't make up things. We rely on peer-reviewed science.
‚ûú The Nutri-Score has been created by the independent French team led by Professor Hercberg.
‚ûú The NOVA groups on food processing have been designed by the international team of Professor Monteiro.
‚ûú The additives synthesis is based on reviews by EFSA on exposure levels on food additives.
‚ûú The Open Food Facts community is collaborating with research teams across the planet to improve nutrition research that benefits all.

‚ñ∂ Works well in any condition
‚ûú You can add new products, even with bad or no Internet connection
‚ûú The app loads only the minimum to reduce data and battery consumption
‚ûú You don't need a camera to look up a product. You can also type the barcode if you lack a camera or have an issue with it.

‚ñ∂ Your food, your data. Privacy-friendly app.
‚ûú Your data is yours, and is never sent online
‚ûú You can use the app anonymously
‚ûú You can export your scan history

‚ñ∂ Set up allergen alerts on products
‚ûú Milk, Gluten, Eggs, Soybeans, Nuts, Fish, Celery, Mustard, Sulphur dioxide and sulphites, Peanuts, Sesame seeds, Crustaceans, Molluscs or Lupin allergy ?
‚ûú Speed up your shopping by doing an initial screening of your food with Open Food Facts.
‚ûú Be careful that the information may not be 100% accurate, and detection may not be 100% accurate. So always double check by yourself, with the packaging.

‚ñ∂ More

Open Food Facts is also available on the web at https://world.openfoodfacts.org
Questions, feedback : contact@openfoodfacts.org

summary: Scan food and to get ingredients, additives and nutrition facts
recentChanges:
All 25k OFF volunteers kept working hard: 1,4M products, 182 countries üôÇ
1. OFF goes big in the US: 237k products with Nutri-Score !
2. Dark mode: lighter on your eyes, lighter on your battery
3. Help compute Nutri-Score: slide up for blue questions & get credited for your answers.
4. Massive improvements to the vegan, vegetarian & palm oil detection.
5. Instant product edition even with bad or no network
6. Products To Be Completed page (right menu) is now real time.
comments: I like the Yuka app better because of the overall grade and the quick and easy explanations on additives, but Open Food Facts is a more open system where everyone can edit & improve product information, irrespective of the country /language (for example Yuka does not cover Dutch products).

Opened database relies on people data feeds. Product addition requires 2 minutes with training. Above nutrition facts and labels, you get NOVA food classification (i.e. 4 processing levels defined by UN), vegan compliance and palm oil flags. You can build your product lists. You can review scanned products later (/ local logs). If you don't want to rely on advertising and don't have enough time to inspect packaging, you should try it.

Great, now I can scan and see what's ultra processed! Still there's no Nova scale for marigold nutritional yeast flakes :( I guess it's only minimally processed? Because it's yeast that's dried with no additives, flavourings, colourings, added salt etc? I hope so any great source of B12 for vegans :)
Fantastic way to find out about food ingredients. And you can share info about new products that haven't been added yet.
Quite interesting, although I feel there are more than a few products that are missing.

title: Vegetarian and vegan recipes
description:
Looking for vegetarian and vegan recipes? Fast, delicious, Italian veggie food? You've found it!  
VegMenu is an app to prepare lots of veg foods. Cooking in vegetarian and vegan version some of the typical and most healthy recipes of the Italian cuisine.
 
A cookbook full of appetizers, first courses, main courses, salads, side dishes and delicious cakes, children's recipes, quick dishes, seitan recipes, tempeh recipes, tofu recipes.
Whether you follow a vegetarian diet, a vegan diet or an omnivorous diet, you will find lots of healthy recipes, to suit every palate.

With VegMenu you can:
‚Ä¢ Browse through hundreds of vegetarian and vegan recipes for free!
‚Ä¢ Cook many recipes of Italian cooking in vegetarian and vegan version.
‚Ä¢ Choose the number of portions and VegMenu will automatically calculate quantities.
‚Ä¢ Get step by step help in preparing the recipe.
‚Ä¢ View the nutritional values and calories for each recipe to help you keep in shape!
‚Ä¢ Find menus for all occasions: Christmas, New Year, Carnival, Easter, Halloween etc...
‚Ä¢ Buy ingredients and keep them in a shopping cart.
‚Ä¢ Respect portions by using a spaghetti doser.
‚Ä¢ A spaghetti doser to always respect the portions.
‚Ä¢ Eat healthy and cheap with the help of an in-season fruit and vegetable guide.
‚Ä¢ A handy measurement converter to easily convert from grams to ounces, from milliliters to liquid ounces and from Celsius to Fahrenheit.
‚Ä¢ Search by color recipes to have an iron constitution, or to prepare a romantic dinner for your partner, in short, for the right recipe for every occasion!
‚Ä¢ Look up recipes without gluten, lactose or eggs.

A diet based on plant foods is:
‚Ä¢ Ethical, because it respects animals.
‚Ä¢ Eco-sustainable, because it respects the environment
‚Ä¢ Healthy, because it respects the well-being of your body and of your mind.
A vegetarian or vegan diet prevents many diseases such as cancer, cardiovascular disease, obesity, diabetes, osteoporosis, dementia and Parkinson's.

For technical support or for other help, send an e-mail to the app developer: help@vegmenu.net

title: Eat This Much - Meal Planner
description:
Put your diet on autopilot with Eat This Much, the automatic meal planner. Tell us your diet goals, the foods you like, your budget, and what your schedule looks like, and we'll automatically generate a complete meal plan to meet your requirements. It's like having a personal diet assistant.  
  
Features  
‚Ä¢‚ÄÉ Generate meal plans that meet your calorie and macro targets in seconds  
‚Ä¢‚ÄÉ Nutrition targets can be set up for weight loss, maintenance, or muscle / bodybuilding
‚Ä¢‚ÄÉ Follow any eating style or create your own  
‚Ä¢‚ÄÉ Choose from paleo, atkins/keto, vegetarian, vegan, and Mediterranean diets
‚Ä¢‚ÄÉ Filter out foods/recipes based on allergies and dislikes, including gluten-free  
‚Ä¢‚ÄÉ Set the available cooking time for each meal to match your schedule  
‚Ä¢‚ÄÉ Take the anxiety out of picking what to eat  
‚Ä¢‚ÄÉ Personalize any of our recipes or add your own  
‚Ä¢‚ÄÉ Don't like our suggestions? Easily swap them out or configure the meal planner to only use foods you like using Recurring Foods  
  
Premium features  
‚Ä¢‚ÄÉ Automatically generate a week of meal plans at a time  
‚Ä¢‚ÄÉ Didn‚Äôt follow the meal plans? Easily log what you did eat to track your intake  
‚Ä¢‚ÄÉ Grocery lists are automatically created from your meal plans  
‚Ä¢‚ÄÉ Set a number of family members for each meal to make sure you buy enough groceries  
‚Ä¢‚ÄÉ Reduce food waste with pantry tracking  
‚Ä¢‚ÄÉ Set custom targets for each day of the week, like more calories and carbs on your workout days. Customize as much or as little as you want.  
  
Normal calorie trackers force you to add foods into your diary one by one. By the end of the day, there's no guarantee that you'll be anywhere near your nutrition targets. With our automatic meal planner, there's nothing to track because everything is already entered for you. All you have to do is follow the plan.
  
We offer both free accounts and premium accounts. As a free user, you can create a single day meal plan and completely customize it however you want. Each meal can have different preferences, and your nutrition targets can be whatever you like.  
  
As a premium user, you'll have access to the weekly meal planner that allows you to automatically generate a week of meal plans and send them to you with a grocery list via email. As you follow the plans, you can track what you did or didn't eat, and if you deviate from the plans, we make it easy to readjust your targets for the next week to stay on track.  
  
Try out the free account to see if our meal plans appeal to you, and upgrade to the premium meal planner when you're ready.  
  
Privacy policy: https://www.eatthismuch.com/privacy-policy/  
Terms of use: https://www.eatthismuch.com/terms/

Have a great day!
comments: This is a really nice app. I like that I can put my recipes in and it will calculate the calories of 1 serving based on the ingredients. I am following a paleo diet of 1,000 calories (I actually cheat a bit...a cookie here or there), so I am closer to 1,300, but I've lost 15 lbs. the first month. So far, so good. I just wish it would allow me to add ingredients in oz instead of grams.

Only been using it for a couple of days but the variety that it generates is really nice! Not a huge fan trying to figure out how to get .66 TBSP's or .33 cups of milk for the recipes but the variety is definitely worth that hassle!
It is so easy to use. The recipes are not complicated... And they are delicious. It takes away all the guess work. I finally feel like I found a program I can stick with. Loving it so far!

It's very solidly good. I upgraded to the paid version and I am enjoying the ease of meal planning and monitoring my calories. There are a few areas that are a bit wonky, such as grocery lists that don't fully match meal planning, and not being able to copy and paste a meal from one day to the next. But overall I would recommend this app! One more plus is that if you have a question and you email the help desk they're very good about responding quickly.

I love everything about this app! The grocery list, quick and easy recipes, it's been a lifesaver! I only wish there was a weekly meal prep option where we coukd make multiple servings of one item, because there are some nights where I don't really want to cook...sticking a casserole or something in the oven that I prepped earlier in the week would be ideal for those days.

title: Gluten-Free Diet Recipes
description:
A gluten-free diet (GFD) is a diet that strictly excludes gluten, which is a mixture of proteins found in wheat (and all of its species and hybrids, such as spelt, kamut, and triticale), as well as barley, rye, and oats. The inclusion of oats in a gluten-free diet remains controversial, and may depend on the oat cultivar and the frequent cross-contamination with other gluten-containing cereals.

Gluten may cause both gastrointestinal and systemic symptoms for those with gluten-related disorders, including coeliac disease (CD), non-coeliac gluten sensitivity (NCGS), gluten ataxia, dermatitis herpetiformis (DH), and wheat allergy.In these people, the gluten-free diet is demonstrated as an effective treatment, but several studies show that about 79% of the people with coeliac disease have an incomplete recovery of the small bowel, despite a strict gluten-free diet. This is mainly caused by inadvertent ingestion of gluten.[10] People with poor basic education and understanding of gluten-free diet often believe that they are strictly following the diet, but are making regular errors.

In addition, a gluten-free diet may, in at least some cases, improve gastrointestinal or systemic symptoms in diseases like irritable bowel syndrome, rheumatoid arthritis, multiple sclerosis or HIV enteropathy, among others. Gluten-free diets have also been promoted as an alternative treatment of people with autism, but the current evidence for their efficacy in making any change in the symptoms of autism is limited and weak.

Gluten proteins have low nutritional and biological value, and the grains that contain gluten are not essential in the human diet. However, an unbalanced selection of food and an incorrect choice of gluten-free replacement products may lead to nutritional deficiencies. Replacing flour from wheat or other gluten-containing cereals with gluten-free flours in commercial products may lead to a lower intake of important nutrients, such as iron and B vitamins. Some gluten-free commercial replacement products are not enriched or fortified as their gluten-containing counterparts, and often have greater lipid/carbohydrate content. Children especially often over-consume these products, such as snacks and biscuits. Nutritional complications can be prevented by a correct dietary education.

A gluten-free diet should be mainly based on naturally gluten-free foods with a good balance of micro and macro nutrients: meat, fish, eggs, milk and dairy products, legumes, nuts, fruits, vegetables, potatoes, rice, and corn are all appropriate components of such a diet. If commercially prepared, gluten-free replacement products are used, choosing those that are enriched or fortified with vitamins and minerals is preferable. Pseudocereals (quinoa, amaranth, and buckwheat) and some minor cereals are healthy alternatives to these prepared products and have high biological and nutritional value. Furthermore, they contain protein of higher nutritional quality than those of wheat, and in greater quantities.

Feedback:-
If you have any suggested features or improvement, please leave a comment. In case something is not working correctly please let me know. When posting low rating please describe what is wrong to give the possibility to fix that issue.

Ads--
There are ads in this app. Images for this app are stored on the internet and this costs money. application is free, it does not promote paid version of this app, the only way to support future development is to include ads. Please treat that with understanding.

Download now for free, Enjoy and Good Luck...
descriptionHTML:
A gluten-free diet (GFD) is a diet that strictly excludes gluten, which is a mixture of proteins found in wheat (and all of its species and hybrids, such as spelt, kamut, and triticale), as well as barley, rye, and oats. The inclusion of oats in a gluten-free diet remains controversial, and may depend on the oat cultivar and the frequent cross-contamination with other gluten-containing cereals.

Gluten may cause both gastrointestinal and systemic symptoms for those with gluten-related disorders, including coeliac disease (CD), non-coeliac gluten sensitivity (NCGS), gluten ataxia, dermatitis herpetiformis (DH), and wheat allergy.In these people, the gluten-free diet is demonstrated as an effective treatment, but several studies show that about 79% of the people with coeliac disease have an incomplete recovery of the small bowel, despite a strict gluten-free diet. This is mainly caused by inadvertent ingestion of gluten.[10] People with poor basic education and understanding of gluten-free diet often believe that they are strictly following the diet, but are making regular errors.

In addition, a gluten-free diet may, in at least some cases, improve gastrointestinal or systemic symptoms in diseases like irritable bowel syndrome, rheumatoid arthritis, multiple sclerosis or HIV enteropathy, among others. Gluten-free diets have also been promoted as an alternative treatment of people with autism, but the current evidence for their efficacy in making any change in the symptoms of autism is limited and weak.

Gluten proteins have low nutritional and biological value, and the grains that contain gluten are not essential in the human diet. However, an unbalanced selection of food and an incorrect choice of gluten-free replacement products may lead to nutritional deficiencies. Replacing flour from wheat or other gluten-containing cereals with gluten-free flours in commercial products may lead to a lower intake of important nutrients, such as iron and B vitamins. Some gluten-free commercial replacement products are not enriched or fortified as their gluten-containing counterparts, and often have greater lipid/carbohydrate content. Children especially often over-consume these products, such as snacks and biscuits. Nutritional complications can be prevented by a correct dietary education.

A gluten-free diet should be mainly based on naturally gluten-free foods with a good balance of micro and macro nutrients: meat, fish, eggs, milk and dairy products, legumes, nuts, fruits, vegetables, potatoes, rice, and corn are all appropriate components of such a diet. If commercially prepared, gluten-free replacement products are used, choosing those that are enriched or fortified with vitamins and minerals is preferable. Pseudocereals (quinoa, amaranth, and buckwheat) and some minor cereals are healthy alternatives to these prepared products and have high biological and nutritional value. Furthermore, they contain protein of higher nutritional quality than those of wheat, and in greater quantities.

comments: Great While It Lasted. I really thought I had found the perfect app to track my symptoms. I spent a huge amount of time entering info. Then, I made the mistake of logging out. Now it won't let me log back in. It says it's sending me a confirmation email to restore my data. But I'm not getting it. I've tried a dozen times & checked my spam/junk folder a hundred times. I'm not receiving the email. I'm so very disappointed. I haven't found another app that covers so much detail. :-(

Adding food and meds can be tedious as a lot of options aren't available. This makes sense as the developer is based in Germany and I live in the US. I also don't add each ingredient, because so many foods have some degree of salt or oil, and those show up in the "best/worst ingredients," even though I know those aren't my triggers. I think the most irritating part is that when I add "no poop" so I can log symptoms, it shows in the report that I pooped. Still a mostly useful app.

I like the idea of this, especially the food tracker to see what foods may be causing me trouble. The only really frustrating part is also the food tracker. They only seem to have half the things I try and put in and it really isn't that user friendly with that function either. The rest of it works pretty well so, despite the food tracker being what I really wanted, I mostly just record symptoms which, in itself, is still helpful.

Great app and is very detailed with a nice user interface. My only critism is when adding pictures to food - it automatically offers to crop or zoom in a landscape rectangle and you can never get the full thing you want in the picture as you can only get part of it. It would be better if it was free crop or zoom within a certain squared area, not a landscape rectangle. An option to export to excel would also be great.
The UI experience is bad and not intuitive. I found it frustrating to use.

title: Ingredian Pro: Scan Food Labels
description:
If a healthy diet is important to you, then take a moment to look at a few food ingredient labels at your local grocery store. You'll find dangerous additives such as monosodium glutamate (MSG) and butylated hydroxytoluene (BHT). The U.S. Food and Drug Administration claims these are "generally recognized as safe", however independent research suggests otherwise. But what about the safety of other additives such as carmine or confectioner's glaze? 

Ingredian Pro uses your phone's camera to scan ingredient label text for quickly detecting additives and other potentially harmful chemicals lurking in your food. All detected ingredients are sorted in order by category with web links to provide additional information for each one. 

Ingredian Pro can also assist in detecting allergens such as eggs, dairy, fish, nuts, soy and wheat. It also includes various diets such as an Alpha-gal diet  to detect ingredients derived from red meat.

Features:
 ¬† ‚úî Ingredient categories: Allergens, Anti-caking agents, Anti-foaming agents, Bleaching agents, Buffering agents, Colorings, Countries of origin, Emulsifiers, Enzymes, Flavorings, Miscellaneous, Nutrients, Oils, Preservatives, Probiotics, Solvents, Spices/Herbs, Stabilizers & Sweeteners
 ¬† ‚úî Diets supported: Alpha-gal, Dairy-free, Fish-free, Gluten-free, Nut-free, Vegan & Vegetarian
 ¬† ‚úî Ingredient Safety options: Safe (green), Caution (yellow), Unsafe (red), Danger (blue)
 ¬† ‚úî Performs fast real-time scans. No need to crop a picture and wait for results
 ¬† ‚úî Supports scanning of large labels such as ones found on frozen pizza boxes
 ¬† ‚úî Ingredients are detected by the device with no server intervention
 ¬† ‚úî Detected ingredients scroll across the screen for quick review
 ¬† ‚úî Supports customization of detectable ingredients and diets
 ¬† ‚úî Camera Zoom option for setting initial zoom from 0 - 100% 
 ¬† ‚úî Speech Synthesizer option to speak ingredients detected
 ¬† ‚úî Detects over 300 allergens from Abalone to Zucchini
 ¬† ‚úî Web links to food safety gov and nutrition info sites
 ¬† ‚úî Scan Accuracy options: Good, Better & Best 
 ¬† ‚úî Scan Mode options: Automatic & Manual
 ¬† ‚úî Camera Flash option for use in low light
 ¬† ‚úî Unlimited number of scans permitted
 ¬† ‚úî High-contrasting user interface
 ¬† ‚úî Minimal permissions required
 ¬† ‚úî Low power consumption
 ¬† ‚úî Database Search option
 ¬† ‚úî Show diet compliancies
 ¬† ‚úî Small download size
 ¬† ‚úî No advertisements!

This app has no data tracking and no required user sign-in. Intended only for the U.S.A. and its territories.

Note: Some older Samsung Galaxy devices have autofocus issues that could prevent them from working with this and other Android apps. Click on this link for a possible remedy:
https://removeandreplace.com/2016/06/09/10-reasons-why-a-samsung-galaxy-phone-is-taking-blurry-pictures

Email us for questions or to request a new database ingredient at CadresSoftware@gmail.com

comments: My husband has Alpha-Gal and my sister has celiac. Being able to scan and check in a hurry has been a blessing. My only downside is I have often unchecked the boxes with things my hubby can tolerate with his AG such as the sugars and carranegan, but it still hits red and doesn't seem to save.

App doesn't work well for allergens. Product can have "processed in facility that also handles eggs" and then app will say that the product contains eggs. Or if you scan a cereal and mentions calories with milk it then shows that the product contains milk. Actually continued using the app over the last few weeks and found it quite useful. Would give it 5 stars if it had a feature to denote the difference between containing vs processed in facility that handles x allergen product.
This app has helped me greatly, newly diagnosed with Alpha Gal, this app has saved me from countless reactions. Its the best money Ive spent for sure.
Needs work-doesn't appear to save allergens ingredients and a diet simultaneously. whenbi go back in to app ibhave to recheck. Plese fix and add Alpha-gal.
Game changer! No more guessing games when it comes to food shopping with multiple food allergies.

title: Intol 3 - Scans Food Intolerances
description:
You put one product after another back on the shelf because you can't tolerate it?
You now know that the intolerable ingredient is hidden at the back of the table of contents, but do you still sometimes catch one?

That won't happen to you in the future, because here comes Intol 3!

Intol 3 scans lists of ingredients and immediately recognizes what you do not tolerate.

Whether at home or directly in the supermarket:
Simply hold the camera of your smartphone on the content of the packaging. The ingredients are marked in color:

Red ~ not tolerable
Orange ~ poorly tolerable
Yellow ~ moderately tolerable

A green "Tolerated" means that you can tolerate it. Scanned, checked!

The following intolerances are supported:

‚Ä¢ Lactose intolerance
‚Ä¢ Histamine intolerance
‚Ä¢ Fructose intolerance
‚Ä¢ Gluten intolerance (Coeliac disease)
‚Ä¢ Sorbitol intolerance
‚Ä¢ Salicylic acid intolerance
‚Ä¢ Glutamate intolerance
‚Ä¢ Special nutrition during pregnancy

Intol 3 also helps you during pregnancy!
When you're pregnant, special rules apply. Intol 3 helps you to recognize those foods in the jungle that you should avoid during this time.

With the Ingredients search function you can search for specific ingredients. Similar ingredients are also found and sorted by degree of intolerance.

If you want to add your own ingredients that you don't tolerate, just add them to the app settings. Intol 3 will then mark them red when scanning and searching for ingredients.


Required permissions
‚Ä¢ Camera access to scan the ingredients list
‚Ä¢ Vibration to give feedback on detected incompatible ingredients


Intol 3 is ad-free and works without mobile data, Wi-Fi or user tracking. Visually impaired people can contact the support e-mail address and receive instructions with special operating aids from Intol. 

Handicapped people can find a detailed instruction manual at https://www.intol.de/en/anleitung-fuer-sehbehinderte-menschen/



Keywords: histamine, lactose, lactose-free app, fructose, gluten-free app, celiac disease app, sorbitol, salicylic, incompatibility, intolerance, food intolerance, allergy, pregnant food, glutamate

Welcome to the Gluten Free Recipes Application Volume 3!

This is the ultimate recipe dictionary for Gluten-Free Holiday dishes. "Gluten-Free Recipes" is a Android mobile device application that contains many Gluten-Free Food Recipes for all Holiday occasions. At a touch of a finger, you can easily find holiday recipes by searching the Recipe List.

Data includes:

    -Dish Ingredients
    -Dish Directions

Search Features:

title: My Gluten Free Recipes
description:
My Gluten Free Recipes is a totally free app that provides a selection of the best and the Healthiest Gluten-Free Recipes available around the web for the people suffering Coeliac Disease or Gluten Intolerance who follows a Gluten-Free Diet .

Gluten is a general name for proteins found in wheat and rye that helps foods maintain their shape, acting as a glue that holds food together. Gluten can be found in many types of foods, even ones that would not be expected.

This app gives you access to Hundreds of Gluten-Free Recipes that are going to be updated on monthly basis . The Recipes are broken into 7 Categories :  

Breakfast & Brunch  
Appetizers  
Bread  
Main Dishes 
Side Dishes
Desserts 

And a special menu for Favorite Recipes where you can find all your preferred Gluten-Free Dishes .

On every recipe you gonna find detailed preparation instructions and informations like Time , Servings , and Calories ..

You can make you Shopping List from the ingredients and send it via your social apps .

Enjoy Cooking and Stay Healthy :) !

title: PlateJoy
description:
Healthy eating, simplified. Achieve your health & fitness goals with custom-designed meal plans and grocery lists tailored to you.

Personalized meal plans for any lifestyle: Paleo, Gluten Free, Weight Loss, Kid Friendly, Vegetarian, Vegan, Low Carb, Low Fat, Diabetic & Prediabetic, low FODMAP and more.

HOW IT WORKS:
1) Take the lifestyle quiz to tell us how you like to eat. Share your taste preferences, fitness goals, dietary preferences, allergies and schedule. 
2) PlateJoy's algorithms use 50 different data points about you to create an ultra-personalized menu (rather than a one-size-fits-all plan).
3) Get tailor-made meal plans on your schedule, to make healthy eating simple, convenient and delicious. Optional grocery delivery.

recentChanges: Updated Withings SDK to v4.16 for improved scale connection
comments: I've had a great experience with this app! The food is delicious and easy to cook. I absolutely love the shopping list feature. One thing I would really like is for an actual breakdown of how many grams of food each person should eat. For example, it tells me that I should eat 44% of the food, but we usually use a bit more ingredients than the recipe calls for (ie., Using 2lbs of meat instead of 1.75 lbs). Having an actual weight for the nutrition breakdown would be immensely helpful.

I like this app but it needs some work to make it more user friendly. Like once you make a dish from your weekly menu you should be able to check it off. I love the shopping list and pantry feature, but how about letting me add stuff to the shopping list so that I don't have to have two lists?

So far I am super impressed I am on an elimination diet and suspected to be sensitive to garlic. I listed garlic and garlic salt as an ingredient to avoid. My first experience with the suggested meals at Whole Foods, the kielbasa and substitutes all had garlic salt. I had to put back the ingredients for that meal when I canceled it. I lost time but I also saved a lot of time with the shopping list feature, It's amazing! Please consider integrating with Lose it!

The layout and concept of the meal plans is great. However I accidentally created a meal plan and it won't let me delete it. I can only create a new one but then the ingredients are based off the previous meal plan that was created by accident and I can't reset it. I would contact support but they don't offer in app support?

this is a great plan, for me personally. love the recipes, qiuck, easy and oh ao tasty. I don't stick to it like the bible, but use it as a tool to fit my lifestyle and it helps keep me on track. I'm down a total of 25 lbs in a yr 1/2 . it's definitely a lifestyle change. I totally recommend! Thanks Christine and coaches!

title: Find Vegan Restaurants & Vegetarian Food- HappyCow
description:
Top vegan app in 180+ countries, this FREE healthy food locator is Android‚Äôs #1 vegan and vegetarian restaurant app guide! Use HappyCow to find gluten-free, vegan, or vegetarian restaurants near you and see 700,000+ reviews, or search up plant-based restaurants anywhere in the world when traveling. Our healthy dining finder is easy and free, and can be used for your 21 Day Vegan Kickstart! 

SEARCH:
‚òÖ Find 130,000+ vegan, vegetarian, plant-based, and gluten-free restaurants
‚òÖ Discover local health food stores, grocery stores, and farmers‚Äô markets
‚òÖ Help plan a healthy diet, weight loss, or your 21 Day Vegan Kickstart
‚òÖ Search by location on an interactive map, perfect when planning a trip or traveling
‚òÖ Read 1,000,000+ reviews/photos to see users‚Äô feedback, use it to find a top-rated cafe or restaurant
‚òÖ Get hours, directions, photos, and reviews of restaurants and grocery stores with vegan food

COMMUNITY/ENGAGE:
‚òÖ Share your favorite healthy restaurants with your friends
‚òÖ Upload photos of your delicious plant-based or gluten-free meals 
‚òÖ Submit reviews and advice for fellow users
‚òÖ Language support for Chinese, Dutch, English, French, German, Hebrew, Italian, Japanese, Polish, Spanish, and Portuguese

With the FULL / UPGRADED version you also get:
1) SAVE listings to your device for offline viewing, when you don't have Internet connection. Add places to visit to your Trips and Favorites lists.
2) SYNC & BACKUP  your Trips and Favorites lists with your member account.
3) FILTER businesses that are OPEN NOW only, so you don‚Äôt show up hungry at a closed restaurant! 
4) SEARCH by Keyword (i.e. Pizza, Organic, Japanese, Bakery, Mexican, Gluten-Free, Raw). It‚Äôs especially useful in big cities with too many options!
5) ALL Reviews. See all of our member reviews, not just the first 3.
6) NO Ads.
7) GOOD KARMAfor supporting this project and furthering the cause! Be happy with HappyCow.

You can use our app to plan meal prepping, healthy eating, diet, weight loss, or your 21 Day Vegan Kickstart. With HappyCow, it‚Äôs EASY and FREE to lead a healthy, plant-based lifestyle! 

Find vegan, vegetarian, veg-friendly, gluten-free, healthy restaurants, and health food markets and other vegetarian businesses nearby: whether you‚Äôre going to work, school, or traveling! Our top vegan app provides lists and maps of healthy dining in 180+ countries. 

Additionally, you can discover veg businesses like a vegan bakery or vegan store, vegetarian B&B, vegan catering, food trucks and farmers market. Featuring 1 million+ photos & reviews by vegetarians and vegans you can trust.

Currently not working in China without a VPN.

*********

NEED SUPPORT OR HAVE FEEDBACK?
Please contact us before leaving feedback or rating -- we‚Äôd like to help you.
Most issues resolved by uninstalling, restarting your device, then reinstalling.

Questions & feedback- please email: android@happycow.net

Please consider supporting HappyCow and this project by upgrading to the full version!

---

Q&A:

Why are permissions needed?

Location:
The app uses your device location to find restaurants near you. We do not store your  location on our servers.

Photos/Media/Files:
The app allows you to upload photos from your phone/tablet. We never access your photos until you choose to view them from within the app.

Camera:
The app allows you to take photos of your favorite restaurants. The app stores these photos with your other pictures on your device so you may admire them whenever you please, or upload at a later date. We never access your camera or save photos until you perform those actions from within the app.

Other:
We communicate with the HappyCow database to bring you the best vegan and vegetarian restaurants in the world!

---

title: Gluten Dude: Got Celiac? Live a Better Life.
description:
The purpose of my app is simple: to better the lives of those living with celiac disease and anyone else who must eat gluten-free; to create a close-knit community where people in the gluten-free community come to discover, to learn, to share, and to connect, all to make their lives easier and healthier.

Living a 100% gluten-free life certainly has it challenges: physically, mentally and socially. Using the Gluten Dude app will help alleviate those challenges.

CHALLENGE: EATING OUT SAFELY
Eating out is one of the more stressful parts of having celiac disease. One crumb is all it takes to set off the autoimmune response. Everything that is fun and spontaneous about eating out can be overshadowed by the anxiety of whether you can get through your meal unscathed.

Solution: A directory of only 100% gluten-free restaurants, guaranteeing you a safe meal. Each restaurant includes images, a description, reviews, ratings, directions, etc. The app currently covers the US, Canada, Paris, Italy, London, Spain, Germany, Hong Kong, New Zealand and Australia, with more locations coming. 

Note: Recommended but Non-100% GF restaurants are now included on the app as well but are clearly delineated. These restaurants are personally vetted before being added to the app. NEW RESTAURANTS ADDED EVERY DAY!

CHALLENGE: GETTING BAD/WRONG ADVICE
The internet is littered with falsehoods and dangerous information regarding celiac disease. People are looking for answers to their problems, quickly and accurately, and they are not sure where to turn or who to trust, putting their health in jeopardy.

Solution: A forum where fear mongering and misinformation will be strongly discouraged. Varying opinions? Absolutely. But no "McDonalds French Fries are gluten free" kind of stuff. There are a number of topics where you‚Äôll be able to chime in with questions, answers and advice. The forum includes Ask the Community, Ask Gluten Dude, Share Your Celiac Story, and more.

You also have access to videos from yours truly (Gluten Dude), where I answer reader emails, throw out some celiac rants and talk about the world of celiac disease.

CHALLENGE: ISOLATION
Celiac disease is a very misunderstood disease and can be quite isolating. I've received so many emails over the years from people whose own friends and family don't take their disease seriously; who don't get invited out to eat because they're "too difficult"; who are bullied at school simply because they can't eat gluten. And most of the time, there is no one there to turn to, to listen to you, to understand you.

SOLUTION: Live chat. This app will connect you with others in the celiac/GF community, allowing one on one private chats. You‚Äôll even have the option of providing your zip code, allowing people to search for others by location.

CHALLENGE: FINDING GLUTEN-FREE BEER
Beer, sadly, is not gluten-free. The most popular "gluten-free" beers on the market today are actually "gluten-removed" and are not safe to drink. There are a handful of amazing 100% gluten-free beers out there, but they can be difficult to find.

Solution: The Gluten Dude app shows the stores, bars and restaurants where people can purchase gluten-free beer. The user will be able to search by any location and each location will show which specific gluten-free beers each establishment carries. Cheers!

AND LASTLY...WHO THE HECK IS GLUTEN DUDE?
My real name is Scott but within the celiac and gluten-free communities, I'm known as Gluten Dude, a popular, passionate and outspoken celiac disease advocate. I was diagnosed with celiac disease in 2008 and I launched my blog in 2011. Here are a few kudos from my fellow celiacs:

"Thank you from the bottom of my heart. You changed the journey for me." - Joyful

"You make me smile, you make me cry, and you make me mad. But most of all, you make me grateful that I don‚Äôt have to figure this all out on my own." - Darlena

"Your latest post is why my son wants to be Gluten Dude when he grows up." - Denise

recentChanges:
- Bug Fixes and Improvement.
- Added image editor to edit image on profile and forum post and in comment section.
- New Dashboard View.
- New ui for Let's Discuss Section.

comments: Just downloaded the app, so really just starting to see what information is available. I live in a more rural area of my state, so many of the current restaurant references I'm seeing are well out of my area. I also recognize that it takes a village and that over time more information will come online as others join, the community grows and the app evolves. I like what I'm seeing so far, and look forward to learning more from the app.
Easy to navigate and fast

Someone who must eat gluten free should download this app. Not only is it a directory of safe places to eat, it is a community-based app where you can connect with others. This is like a portable toolbox for the GF community.

title: Gluten-Free Recipes - Grocery Lists & Meal Plans
description:
Gluten-Free Recipes is a simple way to browse hundreds of recipes, create grocery lists, and personalize meal plans. Regardless if you are looking for a quick recipe or a full meal plan to maintain a gluten-free diet, Gluten-Free Recipes can help you find exactly what you are looking for. The app includes full nutrition facts, macro breakdowns of each recipe, and cooking directions.

Use Gluten-Free Recipes to:
Browse hundreds of recipes by name or ingredients.
Save your favorite recipes for easy reference later.
Easily add ingredient details for any recipe to your grocery list.
Generate personalized meal plans based on your diet goals.
View nutrition facts, macro breakdowns, and cooking directions for any recipe.
descriptionHTML:
Gluten-Free Recipes is a simple way to browse hundreds of recipes, create grocery lists, and personalize meal plans. Regardless if you are looking for a quick recipe or a full meal plan to maintain a gluten-free diet, Gluten-Free Recipes can help you find exactly what you are looking for. The app includes full nutrition facts, macro breakdowns of each recipe, and cooking directions.

Use Gluten-Free Recipes to:
Browse hundreds of recipes by name or ingredients.
Save your favorite recipes for easy reference later.
Easily add ingredient details for any recipe to your grocery list.
Generate personalized meal plans based on your diet goals.
View nutrition facts, macro breakdowns, and cooking directions for any recipe.
summary: A simple way to browse recipes, create grocery lists, & personalize meal plans
recentChanges: Bug fixes and performance improvements.

title: mySymptoms Food Diary & Symptom Tracker (Lite)
description:
Record, track, and analyze your food, mood, and symptoms to gain insights into your digestive health. 

mySymptoms makes logging a food and symptom diary easy - remembering your favorite foods and providing customizable symptoms. The diary analysis reveals any patterns that emerge between your diet and symptoms. Print a PDF (Android 4.4 or above) / web report of your diary/journal.


DIARY / JOURNAL

‚Ä¢ Record food, drink, medication, stress, exercise, environmental factors, and other activities and notes 
‚Ä¢ Record any symptoms you experience (including intensity, duration, and notes) 
‚Ä¢ Record your energy, sleep quality, and bowel movements (using Bristol scale)
‚Ä¢ View and modify your diary entries 
‚Ä¢ Create and modify your own symptoms 
‚Ä¢ Export your food diary as a PDF (Android 4.4 or above), CSV, or Web report for printing or sharing


INSIGHTS

‚Ä¢ Discover any patterns between your diet and symptoms
‚Ä¢ View suspect foods, trends, and correlations between food and symptoms
‚Ä¢ Configurable analysis


ORGANIZER 

‚Ä¢ Add or modify your own drinks, foods, medications, exercises, and other activities 
‚Ä¢ Add or modify meals with your own ingredients 
‚Ä¢ Add or modify detailed ingredients to any item ‚Äì food, drink or medication 


HOW TO USE

‚Ä¢ Simply begin by tracking your meals along with any symptoms you experience
‚Ä¢ Over time, the more you track, the more the analysis algorithms have to work with to provide any insights


mySymptoms is used by sufferers of:

‚Ä¢ IBS (Irritable Bowel Syndrome)
‚Ä¢ IBD (Inflammatory Bowel Disease)
‚Ä¢ Food intolerance and sensitivities such as dairy, gluten, lactose
‚Ä¢ Acid reflux
‚Ä¢ Crohn‚Äôs disease
‚Ä¢ Celiac disease
‚Ä¢ SIBO (Small Intestinal Bacterial Overgrowth)
‚Ä¢ Ulcerative colitis
‚Ä¢ Migraines & cluster headaches
‚Ä¢ Eczema
‚Ä¢ Bloating, heartburn, and many other digestive conditions 

mySymptoms is also useful for recording a FODMAP diet.


Please note that the analysis algorithms use statistical methods to identify suspect foods/items and do not understand your diet or specific health circumstances. 


The information provided by this app is not medical advice. Always consult a doctor if you have any concerns about your health. Always consult a licensed health professional prior to modifying your diet.


GO PREMIUM

‚Ä¢ Advanced analysis including ingredients and food groups (where provided)
‚Ä¢ Detailed results for each item includes more specific information, a histogram and trend chart 
‚Ä¢ Review events a food or symptom appears in
‚Ä¢ No adverts


mySymptoms also provides a list of common symptoms for food intolerance, IBS, IBD and Crohn's, but you can add extra symptoms as required.


Terms: http://mysymptoms.net/terms


NOTE: mySymptoms Food Diary currently supports portrait orientation only.


SUPPORT

If you experience any issues with mySymptoms, then please contact our support team - we will do our utmost to resolve the issue as soon as possible. Thanks!

support@skygazerlabs.com

MORE INFORMATION

Web: www.mysymptoms.net
Twitter: twitter.com/mysymptoms
Facebook: fb.me/mySymptoms
Enquiries: hello@mysymptoms.net

recentChanges: + Fix for file export on Android 10
comments: I just downloaded this app but I already love it! I love that it doesn't count calories and focuses on the way food makes you feel instead. I'm also loving every other category that you can track, like energy level, medication, environment, and mood. This is going to be so helpful with managing my chronic illness! Thank you to the developer! If I continue to use it I am for sure buying premium!

Paid premium, and didn't recieve. Sending questions and suggestions via email, and Facebook. No answer because they are closed on weekends. This is a useful app, for people suffering from gut issues caused by foods. They really need to add nutrition info to the diary because those with gastroparesis need to eat less fiber and not more. I have not found an app where the amount of fiber is customizable. And for this app, it would be appropriate.

Really good set up, easy to use. I like it a lot. I can log any food ingredients that I eat, the time and date, my mood at the time, and any symptoms I get, and much more. A very good diary to log my food and drink intake.

Once you've got your regular entries in its really quick to use. I like the range of options available. Mealtimes, exercise, mood, environment, sleep etc. Finding it really useful, plus I can send a report to my GP. üòä
This is the best app I could have found to help me focus on my eating and health. I like the flexibility of being able to write notes for entries and to add symptoms. I highly recommend to others.

title: ShopWell - Better Food Choices
description:
Know your Food. Shopwell. 
 
The free Shopwell app simplifies nutrition labels and helps you discover new foods that fit your lifestyle. 
 
Shopwell provides personalized nutrition scores when you create a Food Profile with your dietary goals, health concerns, allergies and dislikes. Simply scan any item to see quick nutritional information and learn how it matches with your needs -- not an average. Discover products that are a better match for you. Create lists of your favorite finds and share them with family and friends. It‚Äôs that easy. 
 
Shopwell personalized results are a free, easy and fun way to discover the foods that are right for you.
 
 
Features:
 
‚Äî Barcode scanner translates nutritionals into quick, easy-to-digest information on more than 400,000 foods
‚ÄîPersonalized food recommendations.
‚Äî Location awareness to find products in your local grocery store.
‚Äî NEW! Create lists of your favorite foods and share them with your friends and family. Follow lists made by your friends and celebrity influencers
 
We help you stay on track by offering alerts and support for food allergies and food goals including:
 
Pregnancy
Gluten Free

comments: Best app I found for seeing if certain foods will aggravate my food sensitivities without having to scan every goddamned label and look everything up myself. Could stand to be fleshed out a bit more, but a great tool nonetheless.
This is a very addictive sites to look at ingredients but no longer possible to use it on browser unless you just browse by the category only but good to look at nutrition fact.

I began using this app when my doctor recommended I do the low fodmap diet for 6 weeks. I thought this would make shopping for specific foods a lot easier. Boy, was I wrong. It is not accurate when you scan items in the store. For example, I would scan items, and it would say to avoid this item because of a certain ingredient in it, like soy. I would then look at the ingredients on the product and nowhere would it be listed. I would not recommend this app.

So far so good! My only suggestion would be to add a filter menu to searches / scanned items / lists, which provides options for sorting by food groups, brands, descending/ascending number rating, and excellent, good, poor, etc. matches only. As it is, looking through lists and searches is a nightmare when you have a LOT of items to look through. Another helpful feature would be to add an option to filter out duplicate items in searches--I once had a search give me 10+ dupes for several items.

I was reluntant at first to try this app due to a lot of negative reviews and comments. I just found out some food allergies that is includes in lots of foods, such as wheat, and this app is a good help. It also helps with other ingredients you want to avoid, such as sugar, etc. It even shows you foods that will be good for you to choose that disclides everything, which is good for someone new to a bad allergy trying to find new foods to eat. So far, I love this app

title: Food-Intolerances
description:
There is now a new, particularly user-friendly food intolerance app for histamine, lactose, fructose and gluten intolerances.

The intelligent navigation is simple to use and provides rapid information - thanks to the easy-to-understand traffic-light system:

- Search alphabetically or by food category
- Set your personal tolerance level for individual foods
- Single view with intolerances at a glance
- Only display tolerated foods using the filter function

The app's special feature: it can be tailored completely individually to the needs and preferences of the user, because it lets you give your own assessment of each food.

People who are colour-blind can select a modified non-colour-based view of the traffic-light system.

The food classifications are based on details from the SIGHI - the Swiss Histamine Intolerance Interest Group and self recherches.

recentChanges: new Content
comments: This app is a life-saver for making a low-histamine shopping list or planning a low-histamine meal. It has an easy traffic light system. Each food has a sub-section stating whether the food has biogenic amines, histamine liberator status or is a DAO enzyme blocker. The additives food category is very useful as I did not know some of them have histamine. My favourite part about the app is that I can choose to see a single traffic light colour so I can quickly view what foods are safe in an instant.

The English version of this app is very useful, and i consult it all the time at restaurants. It's good knowing that Swiss Interest Group Histamine Intolerance is a trusted source, backed up with studies for it's claims. The app has nearly every food, and special details about preparation for specific foods. I love it.
Great app easy to use

title: Healthy food recipes. Vegetarian & vegan meals
description:
Clean&Green - it‚Äôs a magic collection of recipes for every taste. Vegetarian, vegan, paleo, gluten-free and dairy-free recipes, with us, you will discover a whole world of delicious and healthy food. From simple breakfasts to family dinners, gourmet desserts and sourdough pastries... You name it.

We're sure that food should be tasty, healthy and nourishing, no matter which diet you follow. Here, everyone will find something wholesome and yummy. We only use whole organic ingredients, aromatic spices and herbs! Gourmet dishes are not difficult to make if there is a competent guide and pro tips.

Here‚Äôs why our subscription is a must-have:

‚Ä¢ New exclusive content every week!

‚Ä¢ Over 100 great recipes (plus a new one every week!)

‚Ä¢ Change your serving size in just seconds! Having family dinners and hosting parties has never been so easy

‚Ä¢ Keep up to date with the latest recipes and trends for the current season 

‚Ä¢ Add your chosen recipes to your Favorites for quick access with just one click

‚Ä¢ Recommended ingredient-list replacements are included! Cook with what‚Äôs already in your pantry

‚Ä¢ Vegan, Paleo, Gluten Free, Dairy Free, Whole Grain, and recipes for other diets are all labelled

‚Ä¢ Themed collections make food choices super easy

‚Ä¢ Step-by-step, easy-to-follow instructions

‚Ä¢ Real photos for all recipes 

‚Ä¢ Convenient search-by-ingredients feature

‚Ä¢ Technical updates, responsive support, frequent additions and new features!

From the creators:
"Oh, guys! Our app Clean&Green is the best gift for vegetarians and those who want to eat tasty and healthy food! We have collected our epic recipes, taken thousands of mouth-watering photos and provided step-by-step instructions, so now you can easily cook like a pro. Yay! 

We've been working on this app for a whole year and, finally, we can share it with you. We hope you enjoy it and feel free to give us feedback :) Stay tuned, we are planning to publish more great recipes and cool features!

Let's cook healthy food that actually makes us feel good, 

Anastasia and Dima.
üíå"

CLEAN&GREEN SUBSCRIPTION

$0.99 Monthly subscription gives you unlimited access to CLEAN&GREEN content. Enjoy popular recipes and try new ones; we update the app EVERY WEEK!

‚Äî‚Äî

The price quoted is for US customers. Pricing in other countries may vary and the actual charges may be converted to your local currency depending on the country of residence.

After your free trial, payment will be charged to the Google Play Account confirmed at the time of purchase.

Your Google Play Account will be charged for renewal 24 hours prior to the end of the current subscription period at the current price for the billing period selected.

The subscription will automatically renew unless turned off in your Google Play Account settings more than 24 hours before the current period ends. You can go to your Google Play Account settings to manage your subscription and turn off auto-renew.

Terms of Use (https://anastasiagurova.com/app-terms-and-conditions/)

Privacy Policy (https://anastasiagurova.com/app-privacy-policy/)

comments: Most of the recipes are only accessible through the subscription service; there are very few that are free. It does have beautiful pictures and the food does look lovely.

Beautiful Such a gorgeous app. Smooth and perfectly designed, and the recipes photos are amazing too. The first app I've opened in a long time which has made me show it to others simply for how good the design is. The food and recipes itself is spectacular, especially if you're looking to make something veggie or gluten free but are struggling for inspiration.
Nearly all recipes are locked! You have to buy a membership to access 90% of the content. PASS
Nice app, lots of recipes catering to different needs. Easy to use app and very clear instructions.
You have to pay for almost ALL recipes...
